title: Reverse Vowels of a String
description:
Reverse Vowels of a String

Given a string s, reverse only all the vowels in the string and return it.

The vowels are 'a', 'e', 'i', 'o', and 'u', and they can appear in both lower and upper cases, more than once.

Examples:

  • Input: s = "IceCreAm"

    Output: "AcesrEIm"

    Explanation: The vowels in s are ['I', 'e', 'e', 'A']. Reversing them gives ['A', 'e', 'e', 'I'].
  • Input: s = "leetcode"

    Output: "leotcede"

Constraints:

  • 1 <= s.length <= 3 * 10^5
  • s consist of printable ASCII characters
solution_text:
Reverse Vowels of a String

Algorithm:

  1. Convert string to list for in-place modification
  2. Use two pointers: left starts at beginning, right starts at end
  3. Move left pointer forward until a vowel is found
  4. Move right pointer backward until a vowel is found
  5. Swap vowels, then move both pointers inward
  6. Join list back to string

Time Complexity: O(n) - single pass with two pointers

Space Complexity: O(n) - list copy of string

Key Insights:

  • Two pointers approach: one from each end
  • Skip non-vowel characters
  • Remember to handle both upper and lower case vowels
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    """Verify the reverse vowels result"""
    passed = actual_output == expected_output
    output_str = str(actual_output)
    
    return [passed, output_str]
